change vscode theme to light: {"nodes":[{"name":"Open Command Palette","info":"Press `Command + Shift + P` to open the Command Palette."},{"name":"Select Color Theme","info":"Start typing \"Color Theme\" and select \"Preferences: Color Theme\" from the list."},{"name":"Choose Light Theme","info":"In the theme selection menu, scroll through the options and select a light theme, such as \"Light+ (default light)\"."}],"edges":[[{"name":"Open Command Palette","info":"Press `Command + Shift + P` to open the Command Palette."},{"name":"Select Color Theme","info":"Start typing \"Color Theme\" and select \"Preferences: Color Theme\" from the list."}],[{"name":"Select Color Theme","info":"Start typing \"Color Theme\" and select \"Preferences: Color Theme\" from the list."},{"name":"Choose Light Theme","info":"In the theme selection menu, scroll through the options and select a light theme, such as \"Light+ (default light)\"."}]]}
disable auto save in vscode: {"nodes":[{"name":"Open Settings","info":"Click on the **File** menu in the top menu bar. Select **Preferences** from the drop-down menu. Click on **Settings**."},{"name":"Search for Auto Save","info":"In the Settings editor, use the search bar at the top to type \"autoSave\"."},{"name":"Disable Auto Save","info":"Under the **Editor** section, find the **Auto Save** option. Uncheck the box next to it to disable the auto save feature."}],"edges":[[{"name":"Open Settings","info":"Click on the **File** menu in the top menu bar. Select **Preferences** from the drop-down menu. Click on **Settings**."},{"name":"Search for Auto Save","info":"In the Settings editor, use the search bar at the top to type \"autoSave\"."}],[{"name":"Search for Auto Save","info":"In the Settings editor, use the search bar at the top to type \"autoSave\"."},{"name":"Disable Auto Save","info":"Under the **Editor** section, find the **Auto Save** option. Uncheck the box next to it to disable the auto save feature."}]]}
change my desktop wallpaper to something: {"nodes":[{"name":"Open System Preferences","info":"Click on the Apple icon in the top-left corner of your screen. Select \"System Preferences\" from the dropdown menu."},{"name":"Select Desktop & Screen Saver","info":"In the System Preferences window, click on \"Desktop & Screen Saver.\""},{"name":"Choose a New Wallpaper","info":"Click the \"+\" button to add a new image. Navigate to the location where your funky design image is saved. Select the image to set it as your desktop wallpaper."},{"name":"Close System Preferences","info":"Once the wallpaper is set, you can close the System Preferences window."}],"edges":[[{"name":"Open System Preferences","info":"Click on the Apple icon in the top-left corner of your screen. change the desktop background of my macb: {"nodes":[{"name":"Open System Preferences","info":"Click on the Apple logo in the top-left corner of the screen. Select System Preferences from the dropdown menu."},{"name":"Access Desktop & Screen Saver Settings","info":"In the System Preferences window, click on Desktop & Screen Saver."},{"name":"Choose a Wallpaper","info":"On the left side, select a category such as Desktop Pictures under the Apple section."},{"name":"Select Your Preferred Image","info":"Click on the image you want to set as your desktop background. The change should apply immediately."},{"name":"Using Your Own Images","info":"Drag and drop an image from Finder into the Desktop & Screen Saver window, or click Add Photo/Add Folder or Album to select an image from your collection."},{"name":"Setting for Multiple Displays","info":"Customize the wallpaper for each display by selecting the display at the top of the settings section or dragging an image onto the respective display."}],"edges":[[{"name":"Open System Preferences","info":"Click on the Apple logo in the top-left corner of the screen. please change my desktop wallpaper: {"nodes":[{"name":"Switch to System Settings","info":"Click on the System Settings application in your dock or use Command + Tab to switch to it."},{"name":"Open Desktop & Screen Saver","info":"In the System Settings window, find and click on Desktop & Screen Saver."},{"name":"Select a New Wallpaper","info":"Choose a wallpaper from the available options or click the + button to add a new image from your files."},{"name":"Apply the Wallpaper","info":"Once selected, the wallpaper will be applied automatically."}],"edges":[[{"name":"Switch to System Settings","info":"Click on the System Settings application in your dock or use Command + Tab to switch to it."},{"name":"Open Desktop & Screen Saver","info":"In the System Settings window, find and click on Desktop & Screen Saver."}],[{"name":"Open Desktop & Screen Saver","info":"In the System Settings window, find and click on Desktop & Screen Saver."},{"name":"Select a New Wallpaper","info":"Choose a wallpaper from the available options or click the + button to add a new image from your files."}],[{"name":"Select a New Wallpaper","info":"Choose a wallpaper from the available options or click the + button to add a new image from your files."},{"name":"Apply the Wallpaper","info":"Once selected, the wallpaper will be applied automatically."}]]}
